topic: How to deploy WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to deploy WASM targets using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deploying WebAssembly (WASM) Targets using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides a comprehensive walkthrough on how to deploy WebAssembly (WASM) targets using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understanding the basics of FastAPI and WebAssembly
Setting up a new FastAPI project for WASM deployment
Preparing your WASM modules for integration with FastAPI
Configuring FastAPI to serve and handle WASM requests
Testing and deploying the WASM-powered FastAPI application

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI
app = FastAPI()
# ... Your WASM integration code here ...

version_notes: This tutorial specifically targets Python 3.12+ as it introduces native WebAssembly support.
Ensure you have the latest version of FastAPI installed (FastAPI >= 0.74.0)
caveats: WebAssembly support in Python is still experimental and may not be fully optimized or compatible with all platforms.
This guide assumes basic knowledge of Python, FastAPI, and WebAssembly.
